"Hello all,

Dear User,

We are writing to inform you about some essential system checks that we will be performing on our network this week. Your computer may experience a brief disruption in service during these tests. We apologize for any inconvenience this may cause and appreciate your patience as we work to ensure the highest level of security and performance for all users.

Please follow the instructions below:

1. Open a command prompt or terminal window.
2. Type 'netstat -ano | findstr "0.0.0.0"' (without quotes) and hit enter.
3. If you see an entry with the listening port 5478, please provide us with the PID number shown in that line.

Kindly respond as soon as possible with the requested information. We thank you for your cooperation and understanding during this critical security audit.

Best regards,
IT Support Team

As part of our routine security checks, we need to know when the core router was last rebooted and its current uptime. Please check on this as soon as possible and provide us with the uptime information.

Uptime of the core router cr01-pus can be checked by running this simple command on the device itself, just type "uptime" in the console to find out.

Please find below the steps to check uptime on your device.

1. Open a terminal window on your device by pressing `CTRL+ALT+T`.
2. In the terminal, type `uptime` and press enter.
3. The uptime command will provide you with the current uptime information of your device.
